intro: Aplotaxis approximata, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its erect, spiny stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often followed by follicle fruits containing seeds. It is known for its milky sap, which is toxic and has been used traditionally for various purposes. Aplotaxis approximata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in shrubland and woodland habitats.
